intro: Gaylussacia pseudogaultheria, commonly known as the dwarf blueberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are edible and often used in culinary applications. Its leaves are oval-shaped with a smooth texture and turn red in the fall. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
